Description: Egyptian(izing) glazed composition (faience) 'common bowl'; mould-made or -pressed and covered with a blue blue glazed and brown painted decoration; hemispherical body with rounded rim and base; pale blue colour decorated in brown paint, representing a flying bird within a U-pattern border.
Curator's comments: See E. Peltenburg, 'Hathor, faience and copper on Late Bonrze Age Cyprus', CCEC 37 (2007), 375-394 on the Egyptian 'common bowl' on Cyprus.
Bibliographic references: Malmgren 2003 / Klavdhia-Tremithos. A Middle and Late Cypriote Bronze Age site. (Cat. 146, p. 56, Pl. 36b)
Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 188)
Kiely 2011d / Klavdia-Tremithos: A Bronze Age community in south-east Cyprus (M.2)
